sentences.en: "I'm shaking to be honest, " said Stuart Gietel-Basten, an University of Oxford demographer who has argued for the end of the one-child policy.
sentences.cn: “我真的非常震惊，”牛津大学人口统计学家斯图尔特·让泰尔-巴斯顿评论计划生育政策。

sentences.en: Male preference in South Korea “is over,” says Monica Das Gupta, a demographer and Asia expert at the World Bank.
sentences.cn: 莫妮卡，是人口统计学家，也是世界银行的亚洲专家，她说南韩偏爱男性的时代“结束了”。

sentences.en: Professor Antonio Golini is a demographer at the University of Rome.
sentences.cn: 罗马大学安东尼奥教授是位人口统计学家.

sentences.en: Professor Li Jianmin, a demographer at Nankai University, warns of the outlook for childless males. "Elder care for these single men will be a social problem, " he says.
sentences.cn: 南开大学人口统计学家李建民教授警告说，无子女单身男性的晚景堪忧。“这些单身男人上了年纪后，如何照顾他们将成为一个社会问题。”

sentences.en: The first to use it in its modern sense was Alfred Sauvy, a French demographer who drew a parallel with the “third estate” (the people) during the French revolution.
sentences.cn: 第一次使用该词现代意义的是法国人口统计学家阿尔弗雷德? 索维，他在法国大革命期间提出了“第三等级”（平民）这一类似概念。

words.tran_cn: 人口统计学的；人口学的
